Dorsal column nucleus.EditorialNote: Should really be plural, but wanted to adhere to good ontological practice.  Needs some review though.  Vacillating as to whether it should be assigned as a role, part of or supercategory.
Dorsal column nucleus.Definition: A pair of nuclei in the brainstem. The name refers collectively to the cuneate nucleus and gracile nucleus, which are present at the junction between the spinal cord and the medulla oblongata. Both nuclei contain secondary neurons of the dorsal column-medial lemniscus pathway,
